attributes.action: Encourage Sefton Council To Respond To Citizens More Promptly And Professionally.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Since living in the Met Borough Of Sefton, Merseyside, I have been disappointed in the poor customer service I have received from the council. It seems I am ignored by their housing benefit/council tax departments whenever I get in touch with them, to the point that my letters are ignored & I receive court summons and bailiffs at my door! I was brought up to be responsible about my bills & to contact the authorities promptly if I am having difficulties in order to negotiate a mutually suitable agreement.It happened again last month when I wrote to inform I am off work ill & need to apply for housing benefit for 07/08. The council ignored my explanation letter & request for a form, & sent me a summons!! I know they got the letter because they sent me the form a few days before the summons. I feel like I'm banging my head against a brick wall with this council & I have never experienced anything like it. I feel disempowered & despairing. One takes control of their situation, assumes authorities will appreciate the initiative & good citizenship demonstrated, but ends up in the situation they tried to avoid by taking control! Anyone else had this experience? Sign up!
